item.title: DayZ Reveals New Expansion
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Frostline expansion for DayZ brings new challenges and secrets to the game, set in the snow-covered land of Sakhal.
  • With 83 square kilometers of explorable area, players can expect unique challenges and mysteries to uncover in the DLC.
  • The Fall 2024 release aligns with colder weather in the Northern Hemisphere, enhancing the game's immersive and realistic survival experience for many players.

Zombie survival title DayZ is receiving a completely new area in the teased Frostline expansion set to release Fall 2024. The Frostline trailer doesn't include specifics aside from being able to wishlist the DLC via the DayZ Steam page.

Frostline is the second DLC for the game, and the first new map since Livonia released in 2019. The expansion announcement follows on the heels of news that the title will merge DayZ 's Livonia into the base game , resulting in a price increase.

Related
Popular DayZ Server Has Banned xQc
Renowned streamer FÃ©lix Lengyel, better known as xQc, gets banned from a popular server of the horror-themed zombie survival game DayZ.

Frostline is set in the new land of Sakhal, a snow and ice-covered archipelago. Players will need to bundle up to keep warm, hunt for food, and avoid new predators. Along with the frigid conditions, areas close to the terrain's volcano add unique challenges to survival. The different challenges could mark the area as one of the hardest survival locations in DayZ . Fishing will get an update and new diseases are ready to infect characters, among other new mechanics introduced with the cold.

Frostline Expansion for DayZ Adds Snow Terrain to Survival Title

New challenges aren't the only things Frostline is set to bring. Fans of exploring hidden areas and learning the lore of the land can expect plenty of secrets. A number of large, seemingly abandoned, machines dot the environment, and mysteries are sure to be locked away under sheets of ice. With 83 square kilometers of explorable area, there's plenty players can look forward to discovering. Additional content includes winter cosmetics, perfect for surviving in snow and rain conditions in DayZ .

A specific release date wasn't included in the announcement, only the time frame of Fall 2024. With most areas in the Northern Hemisphere preparing for colder conditions as winter approaches, this could work in the game's favor immersion-wise, further cementing DayZ 's status as a realistic survival game . It's also right before the holiday season kicks off, allowing those with limited budgets to save for the DLC. More details, including price, are sure to be released as summer comes to a close.

While there have been a number of smaller content releases, including new weapons, to the title, Frostline is only the second large expansion for DayZ. It still has a consistent player base, allowing DayZ to remain one of the best co-op zombie games on the market. With the inclusion of a new area bringing new eyes to the title, as well as delighting long-time fans, DayZ's hold on the genre could tighten further.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Players Have a Massive Order to Complete If They Want to Unlock a New Stratagem
item.description:
Highlights

  • Helldivers 2's new community challenge is to destroy 2 billion Automatons for the new Anti-Tank Mine Stratagem.
  • Helldivers 2 players will likely be successful in their attempt to complete this new Major Order.

Helldivers 2 has placed a daunting challenge against the community: requiring players to kill a whopping 2 billion Automatons in order to unlock a new Stratagem. Stratagems are a crucial part of Helldivers 2 , giving players massive amounts of firepower and other tools that can help them complete missions. Now, developer Arrowhead is raising the stakes even higher, placing this new Stratagem behind a seemingly impossible task.

This new order follows the announcement of Helldivers 2 's new Polar Patriots Warbond, which includes several new items, weapons, and armor pieces to unlock. Warbonds are one of the many components that continue to make the game such a compelling experience for players, with other recent Helldivers 2 updates adding giant mechs to the battlefield. In addition to new weapons and mechs, players are also able to use a wide range of items called Stratagems, which can quickly help turn the tide of a mission.

Related
Helldivers 2 Director is Letting Players Decide When They Want the Next Paid Warbond
After the wave of controversy demonstrated the importance of player-choice, Helldivers 2 fans get to vote on the next Warbond's release timing.

This new major order was shared by the Helldivers Alerts Twitter account, which broke down the details of the new mission for the community. Players will need to kill 2 billion Automatons to unlock the new Anti-Tank Mine Stratagem . Helldivers 2 already offers a wide range of Stratagems , and the list continues to grow with more updates. However, if players want to use this new Anti-Tank Mine, they will need to work together to defeat an immense number of Automatons.

Helldivers 2 Orders Players to Destroy 2 Billion Automatons

While this feat seems near-impossible, the Helldivers 2 community should not be underestimated. Previous major orders have been decimated by Helldivers 2 's massive community . In April, the community was tasked with defeating two billion Terminids for a different major order. Terminids and Automatons are the two adversaries found within Helldivers 2 , with each faction featuring a wide assortment of different enemy types.

This new order follows the recent Helldivers 2 PlayStation Network scandal, which involved a planned update that would have forced all players to connect to Sony's online systems in order to access the game. Helldivers 2 is available on both PC and PlayStation 5 platforms and, up until this point, had not required a PlayStation login. However, earlier this year, Sony revealed this new update would be rolling out, sending a shock throughout the Helldivers 2 community. Players pushed back against this update in a major way, review-bombing Helldivers 2 on Steam in an attempt to make their voices heard. Eventually, Arrowhead and Sony both confirmed this update was being canceled, seemingly proving democracy really is one of the most important factors of the Helldivers 2 experience.

item.title: Leaker Shares Some Uplifting News for Persona Fans
item.description:
Highlights

  • Sega is rumored to release new Persona content annually, adding to the extensive library of titles for fans to enjoy.
  • Rumors also suggest annual content for other Sega titles like Like a Dragon and Sonic, exciting fans awaiting new releases.

A new rumor claims Sega is looking to release new Persona content annually. The people in charge at the Japanese gaming giant might be considering new Persona games which would be highly welcomed by long-time fans.

A rumor has hinted that the extensive catalog of Persona titles could grow soon with plenty of content possibly planned by Sega. This would add considerably to the already 20-titles-strong Persona library, allowing fans plenty of playable content for a long time to come. There might even be more content in the future not mentioned in the tweet. Sega had previously confirmed 2024 as a big year for Persona fans , evidenced by the release of Persona 3 Reload .

Related
Why Persona 6's Latest Protagonist Rumors Could Be Highly Controversial If True
Persona 3 Reload continued an embattled Atlus protagonist trend, and P6 following the same route could trigger a press storm for the developer.

As posted on Twitter , Sega might have plans to release new Persona titles, remakes, remasters, DLC expansions, and other media annually. This would add considerably to the already 20-titles strong Persona library, allowing fans plenty of playable content for a long time to come. Sega has yet to make an official announcement. Fans are currently awaiting the release of Persona 6 and the rumored remakes of the first two Persona titles .

Sega May Be Making Its Big Franchises Annual

According to the rumor, Sega is also considering annual content for other titles such as Like a Dragon and Sonic . While more content for these games is welcomed, fans of Persona are eager to see what they can expect, including aspects of the series such as romances between characters in Persona .

The rumor is unconfirmed for now, but hopefully Sega reveals more soon.

item.title: Nintendo Remaining Committed to Physical Game Sales
item.description:
Highlights

  • Nintendo reaffirmed its commitment to physical game sales alongside digital for future consoles like the Switch 2.
  • President Shuntaro Furukawa acknowledged the trend towards digital, but stated Nintendo will continue to support physical distribution as well.
  • Nintendo will invest in the Nintendo Account system for the Switch 2 to maintain long-term customer relationships.

Nintendo confirmed it was committed to continuing the sale of physical copies of its games for the foreseeable future. Despite the increasing digitization of the video game industry, Nintendo has persisted in its support of both physical and digital mediums throughout the lifetime of its beloved current-generation flagship console, the Switch. Now with the successor to the Switch expected to launch within the next year or so, a top executive at the company reaffirmed its stance.

Ever since details regarding the ongoing development of the Switch 2 were leaked, fans have been desperately scrounging through official forums and social media in the hopes of finding more details regarding Nintendo's next flagship console. Users were particularly interested in the company's answers regarding several features, such as the quality of the Switch 2's hardware upgrades , backward compatibility with last-gen titles, and whether the console will still support physical mediums or if it will focus on its increasingly popular digital platform.

Related
Every Major Video Game Release Coming Soon For Nintendo Switch
The Nintendo Switch's library is vast and constantly growing. Here is every major new Switch game releasing in 2024 or beyond.

Some of the company's investors echoed these concerns and were able to voice them directly to President Shuntaro Furukawa during Nintendo's latest earnings Q&A . While Furukawa notably acknowledged the massive growth of its digital businesses in comparison to its status at the start of the Switch's lifecycle, the president claimed the company intended to maximize sales on all storefronts, which included both digital and physical sales together. Furukawa further stated Nintendo currently had no intention of departing from this policy and the company intended to support and improve both physical and digital distribution systems for the foreseeable future.

Nintendo President Believes More Users Will Convert to Digital

With that said, Furukawa additionally revealed he was aware of the increasing trend of digitization in the video game industry and confirmed not even Nintendo was an exception to the ongoing trend. The president believed that as online stores and content became increasingly convenient and useful for developers and consumers alike, more users would gravitate towards the digital medium, and expected the shift in the market would be readily apparent in the years following the release of the Switch's successor .

Furukawa also confirmed the company would continue investing in the Nintendo Account system on the Switch 2 . Though the president did not specify how far the company's support extended, he confirmed that Nintendo aimed to foster a long-term relationship with its customers through the account system across hardware generations, which included the highly anticipated successor to the Switch.

While the increasing digitization of Nintendo 's business model has provided players with unparalleled access to the best titles on the Switch , the trend is not without its drawbacks. Most notably, concerns over digital ownership are prevalent among the gaming community, who are worried that the system might be rife for abuse by major developers and publishers.

item.title: Rumor: Possible Nintendo Switch 2 Codename Revealed
item.description:
Highlights

  • The rumored codename for the Nintendo Switch successor is "Muji," suggesting a minimalist design approach for the new console.
  • Nintendo plans to reveal its next console before March 2025, but it may not be released until April 2025 at the earliest.
  • Despite the "Muji" codename, the final name for the new Nintendo console is likely to be different, as seen with past systems like the Nintendo Wii and original Switch (NX).

The temporary codename for the recently confirmed Nintendo Switch successor console may be Muji. With the highly successful Nintendo Switch over seven years old as of this writing, discussion of the next Nintendo system continues to spread across gaming circles. However, the Big N itself has remained tight-lipped on whether its next hardware is actively in development, let alone when eager gamers can expect to see it.

That is, until earlier this week, when Nintendo officially announced that its next console will be shown off at some point before the current fiscal year ends in March 2025. However, a later translation of a Nintendo earnings Q&A session with president Shunatro Furukawa revealed that the tentatively named Nintendo Switch 2 is not a part of the companyâs current financial forecast, meaning that it likely wonât be released until next April at the very earliest. Furukawa has also advised fans not to expect any major reveals during the upcoming Nintendo Direct event in June.

Related
Rumor: Nintendo Switch 2 Hardware Shipments Have Leaked Additional System Specs
According to sources, some hardware shipment information on the next Switch console may provide points of comparison for users to consider.

Meanwhile, a recent thread on the Famiboards forum (via NintendoLife ) suggests that the working codename for the Nintendo Switch successor has been uncovered. The users in this thread claim to have found this name while digging through code for Switch 2 software development kits , revealing that Nintendo could be tentatively calling its new hardware âMuji.â Some knowledgeable users have pointed out that this is the same name as a Japanese retailer known for its minimalist designs and lack of any logos or branding for its products - hence the name âMuji,â which is Japanese for âplain.â

Nintendoâs Next Console Could Be Codenamed âMujiâ

This codename hasnât been officially confirmed in any capacity, but it does invite some questions and theories about why Nintendo would call its next console âMuji.â The translation of this name could be a sign that the Switch 2 wonât be a radical departure from its predecessor in terms of design or functionality, a notion that several rumors about the console have supported. Shunatro Furukawa recently hinted that the Switch 2 will retain the original Switchâs console/handheld hybrid form factor, something that has helped the Switch become a smash success for many years.

Even if the codename âMujiâ is legitimate, the next Nintendo console will most likely be given a different name when it is officially revealed. After all, the original Switch was referred to âNXâ before it was unveiled in 2016, and before that the Nintendo Wii was given the apt nickname âRevolutionâ during development. Curious gamers will need to wait and see if the name âMujiâ begins cropping up in online leaks surrounding the Nintendo Switch âs successor before knowing if it is indeed what the system is being called internally.
